About

11.11 is a journal featuring noted, invited contributors in poetry, nonfiction, fiction, fine arts, and architecture and design. 11.11 brings consequential art and writing to a global audience, interrogating the consecution of art and culture and inviting reflection on creativity in its manifest forms in the 21st century.

Eleven Eleven was first published by California College of the Arts in 2003 as a journal of art and literature; since then it has been edited by faculty and students in the MFA in Writing program.

The journal was edited notably by (the later) MacArthur recipient Ben Lerner and then for ten years by Hugh Behm-Steinberg.

In 2017, the journal suspended publication for one year while the mission and design were reimagined. The reimagined journal went live on 11.11.18 as a journal of art, design, literature, culture, civil society, democracy, climate change, politics, among others â€“ that is, all the things artists, designers and writers ponder and make work towards.

The team behind the re-launch: MFA Writing Chair and Editorial Director Leslie Carol Roberts; Editor Joseph Lease; Editorial Manager Vanessa Kauffman Zimmerly; and Design Director William Felker.

The title was shifted to the numeric spelling, 11.11, and poems and essays and stories and interviews are joined now by discussions and debates around ecologies and ecopoetics; design and urbanism; architecture and the built environment; and the role of the arts in vibrant urban communities.

11-11 © 2001-2018
